definitions: An expression indicating a return to work, especially work that is perceived as tedious, difficult, or unpleasant.
A phrase used to signal the end of a break or leisure time and the necessity of resuming one's duties or labor.
examples: Well, my lunch break is over, back to the salt mines.
After a relaxing weekend, it's back to the salt mines tomorrow.
The vacation was great, but now it's back to the salt mines.
synonyms: time to get back to it
